exercise: text = 'hello'. Convert this string to uppercase.
name = 'john smith'. Convert this name to uppercase.
message = 'good morning'. Use upper() to convert this to a greeting.
text = 'python is fun'. Convert this sentence to uppercase.
code = 'abc123'. What happens when you apply upper() to this mixed string?
text = 'Important Notice'. Does upper() change already uppercase letters?
message = 'warning: system error'. Convert just the word 'warning' to uppercase.
text = 'python programming'. Create a new string with the first word in uppercase, second in lowercase.
phrase = 'keep calm'. How would you create a string that says 'KEEP calm'?
text = 'Mixed CASE string'. Convert all lowercase letters to uppercase and vice versa.
word = 'hello'. What's the result of chaining methods: word.upper().lower()?
text = 'python'. How would you create 'PYTHON PYTHON PYTHON'?
message = 'error: file not found'. Format this as an alert with uppercase 'ERROR:'.
acronym = 'nasa'. Convert this to uppercase as is typical for acronyms.
text = 'python is amazing'. Create a new string where every other character is uppercase.
message = 'hello world'. Create a string that alternates between uppercase and lowercase words.
text = 'python'. Create 'P-Y-T-H-O-N' using upper() with other string operations.
sentence = 'this is important'. Capitalize the first letter of each word with the rest uppercase.
code = 'python123'. Convert just the letter characters to uppercase.
text = 'danger zone'. Create a warning message with uppercase words surrounded by exclamation marks.
